name: Mercure Manchester Piccadilly Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic, rooms were very clean and tidy. Good nights sleep, great value for money!! Good views over Manchester, close to the centre for shopping and bars!! I would definately stay here again!
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: What a fantastic night this was, the staff made us feel very welcomed on our arrival, even wished us a good night at the Ball. The rooms are weary comfortable and all we needed was provided. Both the Christie team and the hotel did amazingly well in putting this event on to help raise money for a well needed service. The organisation by the catering staff made sure all the food was placed on our tables hot and the food was some of the best I ever had at such a large event. I would defiantly stay at this hotel again...

reviews.text: Perfect location for Old Trafford. The tram stops on the main square behind hotel, and on a weekend is only GBP1.00 return. Location also great for restaurants and bars. Staff at the hotel are polite and knowledgable and will help with anything. The breakfast is also ample, and swift coffee and toast service is with you before you have a go at the full English buffet service. Continental also available.
reviews.title: Man UTD

reviews.text: The room was quite spacious and the bed was comfortable. However, the walls are thin and even on the 12th floor I could hear banging outside at half five in the morning. Wifi is £8 per 24 hours however it is not just the price that is shameful - the internet connection was poor which meant I couldn't do my work. There was a large window which could have presented a good view however they were grubby. The bathroom was clean but so many tiles were cracked. I don't think I would have been so picky if it was in the budget category but it bills itself as more. Disappointing.
reviews.title: Ordinary
Martin,Rick,Gabi!!!
reviews.text: Stayed here for 13 nights in February as I was on business in Manchester. There was a big group of us yet Martin, Rick and Gabi took the time to get to know us all by name and were always willing to go the extra mile to help us with anything we needed during our stay... Unfortunately 1 memember of staff managed to let the hotel down on more than one occasion but simply for the way the three of them dealt with everyone of these situations I would definately stay at the hotel again. I have to I promised Martin I would be back for afternoon tea soon!!
Stayed one night Saturday to Sunday as we were attending the theatre.
reviews.title: Good location and friendly staff

reviews.text: Check in was fast and efficient and all of the staff I encountered on my trip were friendly and more than happy to help. Short walk away from Picadilly train station so we just walked there and back - no need for a taxi, 5 min walk to arndale and shops.
reviews.title: Good hotel and location

description: WELCOME. The Mercure Manchester Piccadilly Hotel is situated right in the heart of the city centre, easily accessible from the M6 and the M60 motorways. Making it the perfect location to discover one of the livliest cities of the North. This vibrant city has a fantastic array of shops, theatres, clubs, bars and restaurants, guaranteed to meet all customers' needs. RELAX IN ONE OF OUR STYLISH ROOMS: Each of the 280 bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom, flat screen LCD TV featuring in room entertainment and high speed internet access, hairdryer, trouser press/iron, climate control as well as tea and coffee making facilities. Upgraded rooms are also available on request. The hotel offers a range of facilities for guests including accessible rooms. THE PLACE TO UNWIND: Enjoy a visit to ARTS Brasserie, serving modern food in stylish surroundings with a friendly atmosphere. Situated on the 3rd floor, overlooking Piccadilly Gardens, ARTS Brasserie is the perfect location to unwind at the end of the day. For a lighter meal choice, room service is available 24 hours a day. THE PLACE TO MEET: The Conference Centre comprises 10 flexible conference rooms all with complimentary wi-fi access, suitable for hosting discreet boardroom meetings or conferences up to 700 delegates. With the added benefit of natural daylight, soundproofing and climate control.Of course, its not just conferences that we're renowned for. Whether you're booking a wedding, gala dinner, private party or a company award ceremony, the International Suite is the perfect choice. Complete with its own private reception area, bar and stage. LOCAL ATTRACTIONS INCLUDE: Old Trafford - Manchester United's Stadium Manchester Central, The Palace and Opera House Theatres, Manchester City Etihad Stadium/Sportscity, Imperial War Museum, Trafford Shopping Centre, Manchester Art Gallery. By rail: Manchester Piccadilly Station 1/2 mile. By Air: Manchester Airport 10 miles. Parking: Chargeable parking. Limited spaces - subject to availability.
